conditions.name: ALT Elevation Criteria
conditions.text: ALT > 3 × ULN accompanied by bilirubin > 2 × ULN indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurological Worsening Criteria
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening Criteria
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis

conditions.name: SRC Safety Review Approval
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee approval for dose titration
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant

conditions.name: Renal Function Exclusion
conditions.text: Participants in renal failure, defined as end-stage renal disease on dialysis (CKD stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min

conditions.name: QTcF Change Criteria
conditions.text: Clinically significant finding including changes from baseline in QT interval corrected using Fridericia's formula

transitionRules.name: Run-in to Treatment Period 1 Transition
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day

transitionRules.name: Treatment Period 1 to Outpatient Transition
transitionRules.text: Participants may be discharged from the CRU on Day 9 to return on Day 22 or Day 23

transitionRules.name: Outpatient to Treatment Period 2 Transition
transitionRules.text: Participants will be re-admitted on Day 22 or Day 23 for Treatment Period 2

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration 15 mg to 30 mg
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29

transitionRules.name: ALT Elevation Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: ALT > 3 × ULN: Reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Hemoglobin Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: Hemoglobin > 20% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous dose level or reduce to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Platelet Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: Platelets > 30% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous dose level or reduce to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Neutrophil Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous dose level or reduce to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: Bilirubin Elevation Temporary Interruption
transitionRules.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN: Temporary interruption with weekly repeat testing

transitionRules.name: Neurological Worsening Dose Evaluation
transitionRules.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening: Investigator and Medical Monitor will evaluate need for dose modification based on copper control parameters

transitionRules.name: Psychiatric Worsening Dose Evaluation
transitionRules.text: Evidence of psychiatric worsening: Investigator and Medical Monitor will evaluate need for dose modification based on copper control parameters

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when parameters return to baseline. Maximum of 3 rechallenges allowed

transitionRules.name: Serious Hypersensitivity Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs

transitionRules.name: Severe Infection Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if severe uncontrolled infection occurs

transitionRules.name: Disallowed Medication Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if use of disallowed medication occurs

transitionRules.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs

transitionRules.name: Post-Study Therapy Transition
transitionRules.text: Following completion of both inpatient periods, participants will transition to previous therapy, other standard of care, or request continuation of ALXN1840

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Voluntary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site after 3 telephone calls and certified letter

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Intervention Discontinuation
scheduleTimelineExits.description: If study intervention is definitively discontinued, participant should remain in study for safety follow-up

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: SRC Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Safety Review Committee reviews available safety data through Day 23 before titration to 30 mg/day

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Outpatient Period Extension Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator approval required to extend Outpatient Period up to additional 14 days

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: CRU Retention Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: At CRU's discretion, participants may remain in CRU during outpatient period for safety or study integrity

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator and Medical Monitor evaluate need for dose modification based on safety parameters

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Rechallenge Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator in consultation with Medical Monitor may change dose and frequency for rechallenge

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Post-Study Therapy Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Treating physician determines transition to previous therapy, standard of care, or ALXN1840 continuation
